p: Different bacteria, such as Bacillus amyloliquefaciens, Paenibacillus curdlanolyticus, P. polymyxa, lactobacillus, and B. megaterium able to degrade cellulose, hemicellulose, xylans, and mannans molecules, thus significantly improve the natural quality of PKC [ 12]. Lactiplantibacillus plantarum strains (especially; L. plantarum RG11, L. plantarum RI11, and L. plantarum RG14 (based on their total score of extracellular hydrolytic enzymes activates) can grow on PKC biomass. It performs synergistic secretions of various extracellular proteolytic, cellulolytic, and hemicellulolytic enzymes essential for the effective biodegradation of PKC [ 19]. The latest findings showed the effects of L. plantarum RI11 on different renewable natural polymers, describing the L. plantarum RI11 can be a potential candidate as lignocellulosic biomass degrader. It can produce functional extracellular cellulolytic and hemicellulolytic enzymes in rice straw, molasses, PKC, and soybean pulp [ 52].
